title: Honoring Laura Child upon the occasion of her retirement after many years of distinguished service to Otsego County
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Laura  Child upon the occasion of her
retirement after many years of distinguished service to Otsego County

WHEREAS, This Legislative Body seeks to  acknowledge  those  individuals
whose  professional lives and civic endeavors serve to enhance the stat-
ure of the State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative  Body  is justly proud to honor
Laura Child upon the occasion of her  retirement  after  many  years  of
distinguished  service  to the Otsego County Board of Representatives to
be celebrated with a party on Friday, December 17, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, Laura Child was employed by SUCO for two years doing  mapping
of  Schoharie  County  prior  to  working for the Otsego County Planning
Department which she began in October of 1980; and
  WHEREAS, In January of 1986, she was appointed  auditor/clerk  of  the
board,  the  position  from which she will officially retire on Tuesday,
January 4, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, Dedicated to the taxpayers and well-liked and respected among
her co-workers, for three decades Laura Child rendered faithful, consci-
entious and valuable service to Otsego County; and
  WHEREAS, In her capacity as auditor/clerk of the board she served with
loyalty, honor and distinction, and was governed  by  a  keen  sense  of
duty, always showing a unique grasp of human problems; and
  WHEREAS,  Born and raised on Long Island, Laura married Steve Child in
January of 1978; a wonderful wife and a loving mother to  her  daughter,
Sarah  and  her  two  dogs,  she  loves living in the country and enjoys
quilting, hiking, fishing, gardening and fixing old houses; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance the quality of life in their community and have shown a long and
sustained  commitment  to  the  maintenance  of  high standards in their
profession, certainly have earned the recognition and  applause  of  all
the citizens of this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Laura Child upon the occasion of her retirement after  many  years
of distinguished service to Otsego County; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Laura Child.
